MEMORANDUM OF MEETING
The Advisory Committee for the Survey of the Needs
of Education for Television Spectrum Space.
The meeting was convened at the Dupont Plaza Hotel in Washington,
D.C. at 9:30 a.m. on February 27, 1961.
Four major problems were presented for the consideration of the
Committee:
a. The reluctance of school and college administrators
to project needs into a 10-15 year period;
b. Methods of projection of needs by this survey;
c. Criteria for determination and projection of needs
by educational administrators;
d. Method of reporting.
1.) It was suggested that the rather prevalent reluctance on
the part of the school and college administrators to project
needs into an extended period might be overcome by the presen¬
tation of more detailed information and helping them establish
conditions of consideration for such projection. Many admin¬
istrators are so concerned with day-to-day operations that it
